title: Can I read one edition book for two attempts of the UPSC exam? - Quora
tags: Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: Yes, in all circumstances. I personally know CSE Aspirants who studied Polity from Laxmikant Edition 3 and cleared both 2017 and 2019 Prelims. In fact, in 2017 Main Exam, their scores were above 100 in GS 2 which largely encompasses Polity. Editions are Additions which are NOT supposed to be bought because they increase your burden in that the entire text has to be re marked again. Value additions are to be extracted from current affairs of the corresponding sectors.
Sure, you can, unless the book is on current affairs. There is , normally, no drastic change in a year's time in other subjects.
